translation.en: [man] This is where it's at.
-It's New York City. -[car horn honking]
Street basketball.
This is our culture.
This is what we do, B.
This is our job.
Yo, back in the day, it was like a big block party.
[man] The atmosphere, the energy.
It was just special.
[announcer] It's jam-packed out here.
The players are putting on a show, and the crowds are loving it.
[man] But AND1, they just took it to another level.
translation.ko: 그런데 앤드원이 한 단계 더 끌어올렸죠

translation.en: [announcer] AND1 basketball is sweeping the nation,
becoming one of the biggest basketball brands.
[man] Tokyo, Japan. Venezuela. Brazil.
You know, it was pandemonium.
[announcer] The competition is heating up.
AND1's newest sneakers are jumping off the shelves.
translation.ko: 앤드원의 최신 스니커즈가 불티나게 팔리고 있습니다

translation.en: [reporter] The line is not down the block. It is the block.
translation.ko: 블록을 따라 줄이 생긴 게 아니라 줄 자체가 한 블록을 형성했어요

translation.en: [man] AND1? They had the best ballplayers in street basketball.
And the best players get the best names. Like Skip 2 My Lou.
translation.ko: 최고의 선수 중에는 스킵 2 마이 루도 있었고요

translation.en: The Main Event.
[announcer] The Main Event!
[man] Shane. The Dribbling Machine.
[announcer] Get your Superman on, Shane!
[man] We talking about Hot to the Sauce.
We talking about The Professor.
[reporter] AND1 is taking on the titans of the industry
translation.ko: 이 회사는 상상을 초월할 정도로 성장했고

translation.en: with no plans of backing down.
[man] A lot of people today say, "Whatever happened to AND1?"
translation.ko: 요즘 앤드원의 근황을 궁금해하는 사람이 많아요

translation.en: I don't know what happened to it. And I was a part of it.
translation.ko: 그 일원이었던 저도 회사가 어떻게 됐는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [man] I could never have started a business without my education at Wharton,
translation.ko: 와튼에서 교육받지 않았다면 사업을 시작할 수도 없었을 거예요

translation.en: but after, like, the second day there,
a couple things became pretty evident to me.
All my classmates were totally focused on what they wanted to do,
translation.ko: 하고 싶은 일에 집중하는 동기들과는 달리 "세스 버거 앤드원 공동 창업자"

translation.en: and I had no idea.
I had probably spent four to eight hours hooping
translation.ko: 한 시간 공부를 하면 네 시간에서 여덟 시간은

translation.en: for every hour that I spent studying.
[Seth] That summer, I did a free internship in investment banking.
translation.ko: 그해 여름, 투자 은행에서 무급 인턴으로 근무했어요

translation.en: I was like, "This sucks. I'm not doing this."
"I wanna do something that I love."
"If every day I get to wake up thinking about basketball,
translation.ko: 매일 농구 생각을 하면서 잠에서 깬다면

translation.en: that will be a great day."
That was the genesis to go start my own business.
translation.ko: 그게 제 사업을 시작하게 된 계기였어요

translation.en: I know the limitations of my abilities.
I was like, "There's no shot I can do this by myself."
translation.ko: 저 혼자 나섰다가는 쪽박만 찰 것 같아서

translation.en: "I gotta find a partner."
[man] Seth and I met each other in seventh grade.
He came to me in college with this idea. So I said, "Yes,"
translation.ko: 대학 시절에 제게 이런 아이디어를 들려주길래 같이 하기로 했죠 절친과 사업하면 재밌잖아요

translation.en: 'cause it'll be a lot more fun to do any business with your best friend.
translation.ko: 같이 하기로 했죠 절친과 사업하면 재밌잖아요 "제이 코언 길버트"

translation.en: Seth talked about this young guy that he met while he was playing ball
translation.ko: 세스는 농구하면서 만난 톰 이야기를 들려주면서

translation.en: and that I had to meet Tom.
[Seth] When you play ball with somebody, you learn a lot about them really quickly.
translation.ko: 누군가와 농구를 하다 보면 그 사람을 금방 알게 돼요

translation.en: Tom has a 3.96 GPA at Wharton undergrad.
I'm like, "How's that possible?"
"Like, the dude's playing basketball seven hours a day."
translation.ko: 농구를 하루에도 일곱 시간씩 하던 친구였으니까요

translation.en: And he said, "Just so you're aware, Tom's kind of a strange cat."
translation.ko: 톰이 좀 특이한 친구라고 세스가 미리 언질을 줬어요

translation.en: He's, like, you know, looking down, not making eye contact, talking real low.
translation.ko: 시선을 피해 아래를 내려다보며 낮은 목소리로 말하거든요 "톰 오스틴 앤드원 공동 창업자"

translation.en: But Tom was brilliant. And he was really the genius behind AND1.
translation.ko: 하지만 톰은 똑똑했어요 앤드원의 숨은 천재였죠

translation.en: [Tom] I grew up in small towns in New England.
We moved, like, three times.
I was a shy, quiet kid,
and basketball was the thing that let me connect with people.
[Seth] So, I talked to Tom, and I'm like,
"Yo, man. Um, you might be interested in pursuing a basketball business?" "What are you doing next year?"
translation.ko: '농구 사업에 관심 있어? 내년에 뭐 할 거야?'

translation.en: [Tom] I had no professional skills.
I had only held very low jobs. You know, dishwasher, busboy.
translation.ko: 설거지나 빈 그릇 치우기 같은 단순노동만 해 봤고요

translation.en: So when I heard they were working on a basketball startup,
that was a lifeline for me, right?
'Cause I just wanted to stay connected to the game,
and I wanted to wear shorts to work. [laughs]
[Jay] We had the meeting at a pizza parlor,
and we were trying to figure out what's the identity of the brand that we would bring.
When you make a bucket, and you get fouled,
'cause you know the basket is going in, you say, "And one."
translation.ko: 그 슛이 들어가면 '자유투 하나 추가'라고 하거든요

translation.en: You don't say, "And one," you scream, "And one."
translation.ko: 그냥 말하는 게 아니라 큰 소리로 외쳐요

translation.en: -That's the ultimate way to talk shit. -It's like, "And one, motherfucker!"
[Tom] And then I had this idea. We can put trash talking on a T-shirt.
translation.ko: 그러다 이런 생각이 떠올랐어요 티셔츠에 도발하는 말을 쓰는 거죠

translation.en: So I wrote up 30 slogans, and I was like, "This is our first shirt."
translation.ko: 제가 슬로건을 30개 쓰고 첫 번째로 낼 티셔츠를 골랐어요

translation.en: "I'm sorry I thought you could play."
"I'm the bus driver. I take everyone to school."
translation.ko: '난 버스 운전사야 너희를 참교육의 장으로 데려가지'

translation.en: "Wear a collar. You just got dogged."
Probably the most famous one, which is, "Your game is as ugly as your girl."
translation.ko: 가장 유명한 말은 이거예요 '경기력도 네 여친만큼 흉하네'

translation.en: [Tom] There were, like, six more,
translation.ko: 여섯 개쯤 더 있었는데 전부 처음 도발 문구를 쓸 때

translation.en: and they were all like the very first time I sat down to write trash talk.
translation.ko: 여섯 개쯤 더 있었는데 전부 처음 도발 문구를 쓸 때 떠올랐던 내용이에요

translation.en: But it was really the culmination of 15 years of playing all the time.
translation.ko: 사실은 15년간 농구를 하며 쌓은 경험이 빛을 발한 거죠

translation.en: [Tom] So when we started with AND1, we didn't know how merchandising worked,
translation.ko: 앤드원을 시작했을 때는 상품 판매나 소매업의 흐름을 몰랐죠

translation.en: how retail worked.
We didn't know anything.
So we were creating our own culture, and sometimes that was a beautiful thing,
translation.ko: 그래서 우리가 만든 문화는 때로는 아름답고

translation.en: and sometimes it was Lord of the Flies.
Two Wharton degrees and a Stanford degree,
translation.ko: 와튼 졸업생 둘과 스탠퍼드 졸업생 하나가

translation.en: and we're selling T-shirts out of the back of a hatchback.
translation.ko: 해치백 트렁크에서 티셔츠를 꺼내 판 거예요

translation.en: The first year we lost money.
But I remember the feeling of someone saying,
translation.ko: 하지만 그때 이 말을 듣고 느낀 감정을 기억해요

translation.en: "I wanna pay you for your shirts." I was like, "Wow."
And people loved the trash-talking shirts.
So we felt like, you know, we might have something here.
And then we ended up getting an order for three or four styles from Foot Locker.
translation.ko: 그러다가 풋락커에서 서너 개의 디자인 주문이 들어왔죠

translation.en: Holy cow. We just got a $13,000 order.
The other stores see kids walking around with our shirts, and they're calling us.
translation.ko: 우리 티셔츠 입은 사람들을 보고 다른 가게들도 연락해 왔어요

translation.en: For the first time, we're not calling people.
translation.ko: 처음으로 우리가 먼저 연락하는 게 아니라

translation.en: -[ringing] -People are calling us.
Okay. We got something here. Like, this is gonna go.
translation.ko: 감을 잡은 것 같았어요 이게 맞는 길 같았죠

translation.en: Turning into some big business for a T-shirt company.
This kind of fashion, not the kind of thing you see every day, but they're on to something.
translation.ko: 흔히 보는 패션은 아니지만 새로운 가능성이 엿보입니다

translation.en: Come on. We wanna do it, don't we?
Well, I was looking forward to playing basketball,
translation.ko: 난 그냥 농구를 하고 싶었던 건데

translation.en: but I guess that's out the window.
You want some of me--
[Tom] Within that first year,
translation.ko: "아니, 농담 아니고 너 진짜 못해" 첫해에만

translation.en: we ended up doing about 1.6 million in sales.
Then the challenge becomes, "Okay. What's next though?"
translation.ko: 이제 문제는 다음 단계를 찾는 거였죠

translation.en: We knew we wanted to be a billion-dollar company.
So from day one, we were competing with only one brand.
translation.ko: 첫날부터 우리는 단 하나의 브랜드와 경쟁했어요

translation.en: Just do it!
Nike was a company we emulated the most.
translation.ko: 우리가 가장 많이 모방한 회사는 나이키였죠

translation.en: And they associate themselves with great talent.
Here we have the, uh, the new, improved Air Jordan.
translation.ko: 이게 바로 새로이 향상된 에어 조던이군요

translation.en: We want to make the number one basketball brand in the world.
translation.ko: 우리는 최고의 농구 브랜드가 되고 싶었어요

translation.en: We can't do that unless we do shoes.
[Tom] That's where the money was at,
translation.ko: 큰 수익을 기대할 수 있는 곳인데

translation.en: and Nike had that whole market on lockdown.
[reporter 1] High-tech shoes and slick ads get more and more sophisticated.
translation.ko: 최첨단 신발과 세련된 광고는 점점 더 정교해지고 있습니다

translation.en: Nike is just doing it.
[reporter 2] Fourth-quarter profits improves to 126 million dollars.
[man] When you bring the right athlete with the right advertising,
it creates a very strong situation in the marketplace.
translation.ko: 시장에서 매우 유리한 자리를 선점할 수 있습니다

translation.en: So now, we need to go and get our own Michael Jordan.
translation.ko: 이제 우리만의 마이클 조던을 확보해야 했어요

translation.en: We couldn't start with B-level guys.
If we're gonna do this, we need to go get an A-level guy.
-[announcer] Marbury behind the back to… -[whistle blows]
There's no "ifs" for Stephon Marbury from Georgia Tech.
translation.ko: 조지아 공대 출신 스테펀 마버리에게 '만약'은 없죠

translation.en: He says he's ready to move on and rub shoulders with Magic and Michael.
translation.ko: 매직, 마이클과 어깨를 나란히 할 준비가 됐다고 합니다

translation.en: Everyone in basketball knew Steph. He was an electric basketball player.
translation.ko: 다들 스테펀에게 열광했고 농구계에선 모르는 사람이 없었죠

translation.en: With the fourth pick in the 1996 NBA Draft,
the Milwaukee Bucks select Stephon Marbury from Georgia Tech University.
translation.ko: 밀워키 벅스는 조지아 공과 대학의 스테펀 마버리를 지명합니다

translation.en: [reporter] This man is a can't miss.
[Seth] We effectively bet the company on Steph.
We said, "We want you to be a ten-year endorsement deal,"
which is unheard of for a kid who had never played a minute
translation.ko: 전례 없는 제안이었죠 프로 농구를 1분도 뛰어 본 적 없는 신인이었으니까요

translation.en: of professional basketball.
translation.ko: 프로 농구를 1분도 뛰어 본 적 없는 신인이었으니까요

translation.en: [announcer] From Georgia Tech, number 3, Stephon Marbury!
translation.ko: 조지아 공대 출신 3번 유니폼을 입은 "1997년" 스테펀 마버리!

translation.en: [Jay] For opening night, myself and Seth are literally courtside,
and we're so excited.
The shoes are hitting the water, coming into Foot Locker.
translation.ko: 신발이 시장에 풀리고 풋락커에 들어올 참이었죠

translation.en: The TV ads are running.
Who knew that all we'd been building was gonna go up in smoke that night.
translation.ko: 우리가 쌓은 모든 게 그날 밤 연기처럼 사라질 줄은 몰랐어요

translation.en: I can still see it. Steph goes up, and I'm like, "uh-oh."
translation.ko: 아직도 눈에 선해요 스테펀이 도약하는데 기분이 싸했어요

translation.en: [announcer] Oh my goodness.
I just broke out in a cold sweat seeing that.
Our faces are white.
[Seth] Oh my God. We just ran a "breaking ankles" TV campaign
translation.ko: 맙소사, 이제 막 나간 '앵클 브레이킹' TV 광고에

translation.en: for Stephon Marbury.
And Stephon just broke his ankle wearing our shoes.
translation.ko: 스테펀이 우리 신발을 신고 말 그대로 발목이 부러졌어요

translation.en: A week before the shoes are supposed to hit.
[announcer] Stephon Marbury being helped off the floor…
[Stephon] I usually recover real quickly, but being that this is a bit more severe,
translation.ko: 보통은 회복이 빠른데 이번 부상은 좀 심해서

translation.en: I'm really hurting, you know, knowing that I can't play.
translation.ko: 뛸 수 없다는 사실이 가슴 아프네요

translation.en: [Jay] And so, we're in the tunnel,
and we see Steph's agent looking at us with just, like, daggers in his eyes.
translation.ko: 그렇게 절망에 빠졌는데 스테펀의 에이전트가 도끼눈을 하고 우릴 쏘아봤죠

translation.en: [Seth] Someone on his team says,
"I might have Stephon go on national TV and dump your shoes in the garbage can."
translation.ko: '스테펀한테 전국 방송에 나가서' '당신네 신발을 버리라고 할 거야'

translation.en: And I literally just said, "Bro, it's been real, but I think we're done."
translation.ko: 저는 정말 꿈 같은 시간이었지만 이젠 다 끝났다고 했어요 이렇게 된 이상 파산을 피할 방법은 없을 거라고요

translation.en: "I can't figure out any way we're not gonna go broke right here."
translation.ko: 이렇게 된 이상 파산을 피할 방법은 없을 거라고요

translation.en: [Jay] We wanted to play the endorsement game,
wanted to out-Nike Nike, and we failed.
Two weeks later, we got this tape. It had been around our office.
translation.ko: 2주 후에 어떤 테이프를 받았어요 사무실에 있었던 건데

translation.en: There were a couple of interns, and they were always watching it.
[Jay] The video blew our minds.
translation.ko: 영상을 보고 깜짝 놀랐어요 "뉴욕시 러커 파크"

translation.en: [Seth] I was like, "Holy shit."
I've seen a lot of basketball.
[chuckling] I've never seen this before.
[Tom] And in this game was 15-year-old Rafer Alston,
translation.ko: 이 경기에서 뛰던 선수는 15세의 레이퍼 올스턴으로

translation.en: who was called "Skip 2 My Lou."
[announcer] Show some love for my homeboy,
translation.ko: 우리 선수에게 따뜻한 응원 보내 주세요

translation.en: Skip 2 My Lou!
translation.ko: 스킵 2 마이 루! "스킵 2 마이 루 레이퍼 올스턴"

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] New York streetball style, it's a style where you just let your imagination flow.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 길거리농구에서는 온갖 상상 속의 동작을 볼 수 있죠

translation.en: [Skip 2 My Lou] It was more poetry in motion.
It was more trickery and sorcery.
I always wanted to deceive you.
A third of what he's doing is illegal right here.
But I don't really think it matters because it's so unique.
translation.ko: 하지만 그건 중요하지 않았어요 워낙 독특했거든요

translation.en: Streetball is hip-hop,
graffiti, breakdancing,
all-in-one.
And the crowd is our music.
Winning has nothing to do with streetball.
[Skip 2 My Lou] Your team, they could lose, but if you've electrified the crowd,
translation.ko: 팀이 질 수도 있지만 관중에게 짜릿함을 안겨 줬다면

translation.en: they were satisfied. [chuckling]
[The Main Event] The court is the canvas.
The style of play that you have is your ink.
And the player that you is is the artist.
A lot of us come up through the inner city in single-parent homes.
translation.ko: 도심의 한부모 가정에서 자란 사람이 많아요

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] My mom had me when she was 15.
translation.ko: "드리블링 머신 셰인 워니" 엄마는 15살에 저를 낳으셨어요

translation.en: I grew up in one of the biggest projects in the Bronx.
translation.ko: 저는 브롱크스에서 가장 큰 저소득층 주택 단지에서 자랐죠

translation.en: I never really had a steady home to practice my skills.
translation.ko: 집이 안정적이지 못하다 보니 연습할 기회도 많지 않았어요

translation.en: It wasn't about sports, it was about survival.
translation.ko: 제게 농구는 스포츠가 아니라 생존 수단이었어요

translation.en: The first time I touched a basketball, I probably was maybe 11, 12?
translation.ko: 처음 농구공을 만진 게 11, 12살쯤이었을 거예요 "메인이벤트 왈리 딕슨"

translation.en: Just didn't really have the basketball skills or basketball IQ.
But my dad would take me out to different parks,
translation.ko: 하지만 아빠가 공원을 찾아 데리고 다녀 주셔서

translation.en: and that's where I honed a lot of my skills.
Streetball, it's a way of life here.
[The Dribbling Machine] It wasn't about money.
Because that was the NBA.
[announcer] Swish picks up Dumars, who lets it fly, and he hits it again for three!
translation.ko: 스위시가 듀마스를 막아섭니다 듀마스의 슛, 또 3득점입니다!

translation.en: [The Main Event] Where we came from,
a lot of people don't have that type of money
translation.ko: 매디슨 스퀘어 가든에 NBA 경기를 보러 갈 정도로

translation.en: to go see an NBA game at the Madison Square Garden.
So for us, Rucker was the main stage in New York City.
translation.ko: 그러니 우리에게 러커는 뉴욕의 주 무대였죠

translation.en: Streetball was born there.
When they first took me to watch a game, I was little and skinny.
translation.ko: 처음 경기를 봤을 때 저는 작고 깡마른 아이였어요

translation.en: I made my way to the front, and I just sat right there on the court.
translation.ko: 코트 앞으로 가서 자리를 잡고 앉아

translation.en: I'm watching my idols play.
Pee Wee Kirkland, Joe Hammond, Earl Manigault,
translation.ko: 피 위 커클랜드 조 해먼드, 얼 매니골트

translation.en: Dr. J.
People that were seven, eight blocks away, you could hear them.
translation.ko: 7, 8블록 떨어진 곳에서도 소리를 들을 수 있었어요

translation.en: You knew where everyone was at.
translation.ko: 다들 어디 있는지 알 수 있었죠

translation.en: Most people at some point realized,
"I might not make D1. I might not make the NBA."
translation.ko: 대학 농구 1부 팀이나 NBA에 입단 못 할 것을 알았지만

translation.en: But you can still go play at the playground.
translation.ko: 그래도 코트에 가면 농구를 할 수 있잖아요

translation.en: So I realized what's on this tape.
translation.ko: 그래서 이 테이프의 내용이 뭔지 깨달았어요

translation.en: It's just pure, like, self-expression.
And that's when I started to understand this is the essence of who we are.
translation.ko: 그게 우리의 본질이라는 것도 이해하게 됐고요

translation.en: We're playground.
We're grassroots. We're everyman basketball.
We're attitude, we're raw expression, we're art.
translation.ko: 우리는 반항적인 태도와 거침없는 표현, 예술이에요

translation.en: And this is a strategic position that Nike can't touch.
translation.ko: 나이키가 건드릴 수 없는 전략적 위치였죠

translation.en: [reporter] We interrupt this program to bring you the following Special Report.
translation.ko: 잠시 프로그램을 중단하고 특별 보도를 시작합니다

translation.en: [anchor] Good morning and thank you for joining us.
It's the day Bulls fans around the world have been dreading for years.
translation.ko: 전 세계 불스 팬들이 수년간 두려워하던 날입니다

translation.en: Michael Jordan is scheduled to make a big announcement
translation.ko: 마이클 조던이 이제 곧 유나이티드 센터에서

translation.en: at the United Center any minute now.
I am here to… to announce my retirement from the game of basketball.
[Jay] Now, all of a sudden, with Jordan being out
translation.ko: "조던 시대의 끝" 갑자기 조던이 은퇴를 발표하고

translation.en: and there being no games on because of the NBA lockout,
translation.ko: NBA 직장 폐쇄로 경기가 열리지 못하자

translation.en: there was a void in the basketball market.
There was this opportunity for new content that didn't exist before.
translation.ko: 전에 없던 새로운 소재를 만들어낼 기회가 생긴 거죠

translation.en: [Jay] As a business,
how can we take that experience of a streetball game at the Rucker
translation.ko: 어떻게 하면 사업적으로 러커에서 쌓은 길거리농구 경험을 이용해서

translation.en: and make it something that actually fills that void?
One of the young guys that we had hired to do product placement in New York,
translation.ko: 뉴욕에서 간접 광고를 하려고 고용한 청년 중에

translation.en: a guy named Set Free, who was a DJ, producer, hip-hop artist.
translation.ko: DJ, 제작자, 힙합 아티스트인 세트 프리라는 사람이 있었어요

translation.en: He says, "We should make that a mixtape and just give it away."
translation.ko: 그가 믹스 테이프를 만들어 뿌리자고 하더군요

translation.en: It ended up being this collection of footage plus unreleased music.
translation.ko: "스킵 투 마이 룹 1994년 쇼" 결국 영상과 미발매 곡의 모음집이 됐죠

translation.en: This is Sway from the World Famous Wake Up Show,
and y'all are about to view the AND1 Mixtape on video.
translation.ko: 이제 '앤드원 믹스 테이프' 영상을 감상해 보시죠

translation.en: Coming to you live. Keep it banging!
translation.ko: 생방송으로 나갑니다 계속 멋진 모습 잃지 마세요

translation.en: AND1 pressed 50,000 old-school VHS tapes.
translation.ko: 앤드원은 구식 VHS 테이프를 5만 개 찍었어요

translation.en: We gave away through the street teams, clubs, courts, neighborhood barbershops.
translation.ko: 길거리 팀, 클럽, 농구장 동네 이발소 등에 뿌렸죠

translation.en: And it was like the new crack. It went rampant in the inner city.
translation.ko: 새로운 균열이 시작된 듯 도심에서 급속도로 퍼져 나갔죠

translation.en: [Tom] Each person sharing it with another dozen or two dozen or three dozen people.
We had this insane viral marketing in the pre-internet age. [chuckling]
translation.ko: 인터넷 이전 시대에 엄청난 입소문 마케팅을 한 거예요

translation.en: After Mixtape came out, I was like a hero in New York City.
translation.ko: '믹스 테이프'가 나온 후 뉴욕의 영웅이 된 기분이었어요

translation.en: Before I know it, I have 20 people walking behind me.
"Oh man, Skip. I wanna walk with you. Can I walk inside the park with you?"
translation.ko: '스킵, 같이 걷고 싶어요 같이 공원을 걸어도 돼요?'

translation.en: [Sway] Look out for Volume 2, y'all! AND1 Mixtape!
By Monday, we had calls coming in from people who had lost their minds.
translation.ko: 월요일이 되자 사람들이 정신없이 전화를 걸어 왔어요

translation.en: We all gathered around the phone, just listening to all these messages.
translation.ko: 다들 전화기 주변에 모여서 함께 메시지를 들었죠

translation.en: -[beeps] -[man] Yo, that mixtape was sick.
[man 2] Killed it, AND1!
[man 3] Skip 2 My Lou!
[man 4] Hold on.
[man 5] Need another one, please!
-[man 6] Where is Volume 2? -[beeps]
Immediately the question was, "How do we do another one?"
So we created the idea for the AND1 Mixtape Tour.
translation.ko: '앤드원 믹스 테이프 투어'라는 아이디어가 그렇게 나왔죠

translation.en: We're gonna put together the best playground pickup basketball team we can.
translation.ko: 최선을 다해서 최고의 길거리농구 팀을 꾸리기로 했어요

translation.en: Get your best five, and we have our best five
translation.ko: 각자 최고 선수를 다섯 명씩 뽑아서

translation.en: and let's put on a game.
But let's not just do it one time in New York.
translation.ko: 뉴욕에서 딱 한 번만 하는 게 아니라

translation.en: Let's start going city to city.
[man] I was brought on at AND1 as a tour manager
and headed up Player Relations.
The idea was, "Hey. We're just gonna do this five-city tour."
translation.ko: 처음에는 다섯 개 도시를 돌 생각으로 시작했어요

translation.en: Really to get content for more mixtapes.
translation.ko: 더 많은 믹스 테이프에 담을 소재를 찾기 위해서요

translation.en: [announcer] Shane!
[The Main Event] I just got kicked out of Rutgers University 'cause of my grades.
Now I'm back at home. My son was four or five. You know, I needed a job.
translation.ko: 집으로 돌아갔어요 제 아들이 네댓 살 때라 일자리가 필요했죠

translation.en: [The Main Event] I get a call from AND1.
"Yo, you think you'll pull a game off in your hometown?"
translation.ko: '혹시 당신 고향에서 경기를 할 수 있을까요?'

translation.en: First phone call I made was Shane.
[The Dribbling Machine] Playing streetball, but it's in my thirties,
and the NBA was far-fetched for me.
I'll never forget.
I'm standing on the corner, and Main calls me.
translation.ko: 모퉁이에 서 있는데 메인이 전화를 했어요

translation.en: And it was going through one end out the other end.
The only thing that really caught my attention was,
translation.ko: 딱 한 가지 얘기가 귀에 꽂혔죠

translation.en: "AND1's gonna give us free sneakers,
free shorts to bust some dude's ass? Let's do it."
translation.ko: '앤드원이 운동화랑 반바지를 공짜로 준다고' '한 경기 뛰어 달래, 하자'

translation.en: [Duke] Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls.
translation.ko: 어서 오세요, 신사 숙녀 여러분 전 듀크 탱고예요

translation.en: My name is Duke Tango.
translation.ko: 어서 오세요, 신사 숙녀 여러분 전 듀크 탱고예요 "듀크 탱고 토머스 밀스"

translation.en: And sit back and relax because this is how we roll.
translation.ko: 편히 앉아서 긴장 푸세요 이게 우리 방식이니까요

translation.en: Duke Tango's the godfather announcer of streetball.
translation.ko: 듀크 탱고는 길거리농구 사회자로 대부 같은 존재였죠

translation.en: If Duke Tango gave you your name,
translation.ko: 듀크 탱고 입에서 내 이름이 나왔다면

translation.en: he's solidifying who you are as that streetballer.
translation.ko: 그렇게 길거리농구계에서 입지를 굳히게 되는 거죠

translation.en: Main said, "Yo, would you like to be involved with this?"
And I looked at him like, "Who would say no to that?"
translation.ko: 저는 메인을 보고 말했어요 '그걸 누가 거절하겠어?'

translation.en: When you see that crowd around the corner,
and then you walk into that park and see thousands of people?
Ain't no way in the world you can be prepared for that.
translation.ko: 그런 광경을 어디 흔히 볼 수 있겠어요?

translation.en: Well, I say, "Yo, Main and Shane,
let's go to Philadelphia and get AO."
"Let's get this Headache."
Then I got Black Widow,
and Half Man Half Amazing.
And so, AND1 did the first-ever contracts with streetball players.
translation.ko: 그렇게 앤드원은 처음으로 길거리농구 선수들과 계약했죠

translation.en: [Tom] The first stop is Linden, New Jersey.
We brought the camera crew to film both crowd and game.
translation.ko: 경기와 관중을 찍을 촬영 팀을 데려갔죠

translation.en: I don't even think I really knew what filmmaking was back then.
translation.ko: 그때는 영화 제작이 뭔지도 몰랐던 것 같아요 "지 록 앨러스테어 크리스토퍼"

translation.en: I just knew I had a camera in my hand,
translation.ko: 제가 아는 거라고는 손에 든 카메라를 통해

translation.en: and I'm bringing the audience with me.
I just tried to capture everything
that I felt and everything that I saw because it was unbelievable.
[The Main Event] This is Chris Hightower's itinerary.
-[Gee Lock] This is a Hightower original? -Official.
[Chris] When I went on tour. they gave me a corporate car,
translation.ko: 투어를 갔어요 제게 회사 차를 내주고

translation.en: six grand in cash, and was like, "Make it work."
translation.ko: 현금 6천 달러를 주면서 제대로 해내라고 했죠

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] We stayed in shit hotels. We shared rooms.
translation.ko: 싸구려 호텔에서 지내며 방을 같이 썼어요

translation.en: We're playing in front of a crowd of 100 people.
And now I'm in a minivan
sitting in the chair from the house that's sliding all over in the van.
translation.ko: 집에서 가져온 의자에 앉아 차 안에서 이리저리 미끄러졌죠

translation.en: [Chris] We were our own street team.
Boxes of tapes,
we're passing them out, passing out flyers,
trying to do every and anything we could to get people to the event.
translation.ko: 사람들을 행사에 부르려고 갖은 노력을 다했죠

translation.en: We didn't know where it was gonna go. There was no blueprint.
And it was really just all about having a platform
translation.ko: 그저 우리처럼 NBA에 가지 못한 선수들이

translation.en: for players like ourselves, who didn't make it to the NBA,
to get paid to play.
[Jay] So every year we go to one of those big trade shows.
translation.ko: 우리는 매년 큰 무역 박람회에 갔어요

translation.en: We're running these videos outside of our booth.
There's a massive crowd, and they're coming to watch Volume 2.
We knew at that moment that there was something here
that could be much bigger than we thought, much faster than we thought.
translation.ko: 훨씬 더 크고 빠른 뭔가가 있다는 걸 깨달았어요

translation.en: Hot 97.5 ATL's original hip-hop and R&B station,
I got the AND1 all-stars. I mean, y'all seen the mixtape.
translation.ko: 앤드원 올스타가 자리했습니다 다들 믹스 테이프 보셨죠?

translation.en: You seen them balling out of control.
They gonna be doing their thing today. Go check them out.
translation.ko: 오늘 특기를 보여 준다고 하니 놓치지 마세요

translation.en: [man] It's going down from 4:30 to 6:00.
If you wanna become the next streetball player,
come on down, this is your opportunity.
[The Dribbling Machine] When we played in Atlanta, that atmosphere was totally different.
translation.ko: 애틀랜타에서 경기할 때는 분위기가 완전히 달랐어요

translation.en: [crowd] Hot Sauce! Hot Sauce!
I can hear the crowd. The crowd is saying, "Hot Sauce."
[The Dribbling Machine] Yo, like, who is Hot Sauce?
[Hot Sauce] I used to play in the hoods in Georgia,
stealing balls out of other people's yards.
translation.ko: 다른 사람들의 공을 훔쳐 농구를 하곤 했어요

translation.en: I had a job, but I never could keep a job.
translation.ko: 직장이 있었지만 꾸준히 붙어 있질 못했죠

translation.en: My nine-to-five was just working on my handles.
I was already a local legend.
Every day I played, people just circled around the court.
translation.ko: 매일 경기할 때면 사람들이 농구 코트를 둘러쌌죠

translation.en: [Hot Sauce] After seeing Mixtape 1 and Mixtape 2,
I was hungry to be on the tapes.
translation.ko: 저도 테이프에 너무 담기고 싶은 거예요

translation.en: But I didn't know what… what it would take.
translation.ko: 하지만 어떻게 하면 되는지를 전혀 몰랐어요

translation.en: That's when I heard that they decided to take the tour to Atlanta.
translation.ko: 그때 애틀랜타로 투어 온다는 얘기를 들은 거죠

translation.en: That's when my opportunity came.
I was in jail, you know, doing some of this knucklehead teenage stuff.
But the day I got out of jail, the next day was a tour game.
translation.ko: 그런데 감옥에서 나온 다음 날 투어 경기가 열렸죠

translation.en: It was like, "Yo. What is this?"
[Skip 2 My Lou] A lot of us are like, "What is he doing?"
It was… It was amazing.
When Hot Sauce did that…
Oh baby!
That was it.
One man took the idea of streetball,
and he just flipped it.
The flair and his image,
it forever changed the game.
translation.ko: 판도를 영원히 바꿔 놨어요 "'핫소스'의 길거리농구에 시선 집중"

translation.en: [Jay] Volume 3 became "The Hot Sauce" tape.
We got the new star. It's done. This is all about this kid Hot Sauce.
translation.ko: 새로운 스타가 탄생한 거죠 이제 핫소스의 시대가 됐어요

translation.en: So we signed him.
[Gee Lock] From the first game on,
he was like an icon.
[Gee Lock] Once he came on the tour,
it was a whole nother animal.
[chuckling] You know what I'm saying? Like, no more minivans.
translation.ko: 제 말 아시겠죠? 이젠 미니밴이 아니라

translation.en: It was three-million-dollar tour buses decked out.
translation.ko: 3백만 달러짜리 투어 버스를 타게 됐거든요 내부는 화려하게 꾸며졌고요

translation.en: -Hot Sauce! -Hot Sauce!
Look, it's the Sauce world now. It's my show.
translation.ko: 이제 소스의 세상이에요 제 쇼가 된 거죠

translation.en: My favorite is Hot Sauce.
Hot Sauce is number one.
I like Hot Sauce. He my boy.
Hot Sauce was the guy that everyone wanted to see.
Not just the inner-city youth,
but even the kids in the suburbs watching his tape.
-He's crazy! -[man 1] I know.
[man 2] Oh my God!
They were studying his moves.
-[The Dribbling Machine] Y2K. -[The Main Event] Y2K.
[The Dribbling Machine] The Flintstone.
The Boomerang.
Then you see people on the court trying to figure out,
"How did he do that?" And then doing it themselves.
translation.ko: 기술을 보고 놀라워하다가 그걸 직접 해 보였죠

translation.en: [man] I was the kid that would watch the Mixtapes over and over and over.
translation.ko: 제가 바로 '믹스 테이프'를 수없이 반복해서 보던 아이였어요

translation.en: I could do a move, but it wouldn't quite be like Hot Sauce, you know?
translation.ko: "그레이슨 바우처 앤드원 슈퍼팬" 저도 할 수 있는 동작이 있었지만 핫소스는 차원이 달랐죠

translation.en: The way he handled the basketball was so unique and innovative.
This guy, like, moves the crowd.
I wanted to captivate the crowd like Hot Sauce.
At that time, I might've been the most popular basketball player on Earth.
translation.ko: 그때는 아마 제가 세상에서 가장 인기 있는 농구 선수였을걸요

translation.en: We got the AND1 streetballers.
They're gonna strut their stuff out on the stage.
translation.ko: 이제 무대에서 자기 기술을 뽐낼 텐데요

translation.en: Let's start it out with Hot Sauce.
-You got a movie coming out in September. -That was a great experience, right there.
As a business, we hadn't really tied the Mixtape to sales.
But when we did Volume 3, The Rise of Hot Sauce,
we partnered with Footaction.
The idea was you have to buy any AND1 product,
and we're gonna give away a free Mixtape.
We have kids from the street. They have a lot of fun.
translation.ko: 길거리농구 선수들이 있는데 다들 즐겁게 뛰어요

translation.en: And every… every, uh, consumer that we talk to connects with them.
translation.ko: "풋액션 대표" 우리가 만나는 모든 소비자가 그들과 동질감을 느끼죠

translation.en: I'm at some store buying some things, and I'm like, "Yo, that's me right there."
translation.ko: 가게에 물건을 사러 가면 제 얼굴이 막 보였어요

translation.en: Everywhere I go, I see our faces with our names.
translation.ko: 어딜 가도 우리 이름과 얼굴이 있었어요

translation.en: [man] AND1 is hot right now. Really hot.
These last two weeks, sales have really been bumping.
And that was the first time I remember Nike paying attention.
translation.ko: 그때 처음으로 나이키가 관심을 두기 시작했어요

translation.en: We got, like, three people, and we're taking on Goliath.
translation.ko: 우리 셋이서 골리앗을 상대하게 된 거죠

translation.en: And when we started to out-compete,
we knew we were gonna be a legitimate threat.
translation.ko: 나이키에게 진짜 위협이 되리란 걸 알았어요

translation.en: [Seth] I'll never forget.
Someone sent me a video from Nike's sales meeting.
translation.ko: 누군가가 나이키 영업 회의를 찍은 동영상을 보냈는데

translation.en: They had a picture of AND1 in the crosshairs.
So it was like, "Got it. Nike took dead aim at us."
We were just consistent a top-two performing brand.
translation.ko: 우리는 꾸준히 상위 2위 브랜드 자리를 지켰어요

translation.en: And we had the mixtape tour. They didn't have anything like that.
translation.ko: 믹스 테이프 투어도 했고요 나이키는 그런 게 없었거든요

translation.en: That's like the heart of the game, and we owned the heart of the game.
translation.ko: 그게 성공의 핵심인데 우리가 그 부분을 장악했죠

translation.en: If you're Nike, you're risk-averse.
They don't wanna offend a 50-year-old guy in middle America,
translation.ko: 50세 중산층 남성이 기분 상할까 봐 신경 쓰거든요

translation.en: and they sell to a broad audience. That's not who we are.
We're selling to core people who are basketball players and know it.
translation.ko: 우리 소비층은 농구를 알고 할 줄 아는 사람들이었죠

translation.en: We knew that Nike felt they had to respond.
translation.ko: 나이키가 대응할 거라는 걸 알고는 있었어요

translation.en: And we had no idea what they were gonna do.
We got it. Let's roll sound.
[woman] Camera speeds.
We are at the ESPN building in the "N-1" Mixtape Tour.
translation.ko: 'N-1' 믹스 테이프 투어를 위해 ESPN 빌딩에 왔어요

translation.en: You know what that means? They don't know us.
translation.ko: 이게 무슨 뜻인지 알아요? 저들은 우릴 모른다는 거죠

translation.en: In 2003, ESPN came to us
and said they wanted to do a TV show based around the tour.
translation.ko: 우리 투어로 TV 쇼를 만들고 싶다고 연락해 왔어요

translation.en: Kind of like when reality TV was growing up.
[Chris] The basis of the ESPN show was to find that next guy.
translation.ko: ESPN 쇼의 의도는 다음 스타를 찾는 거였어요

translation.en: Who's that next level of talent?
[Tom] It's basically like Survivor.
We'll go to Portland, Atlanta, Seattle.
And the winner, the survivor, the ultimate pick,
translation.ko: 승자이자 생존자 즉 최종적으로 뽑힌 사람은 "기회를 잡아"

translation.en: is someone who gets an AND1 contract.
Well, another unique event is returning to the capital city.
translation.ko: 또 다른 독특한 행사가 수도로 돌아옵니다

translation.en: The AND1 Mixtape Tour team is a collection of basketball characters
translation.ko: 앤드원 믹스 테이프 투어 팀은 힙합 스타일로 농구하는

translation.en: with nicknames and hip-hop playing hoops.
If you think you can run with these guys, show up tomorrow from 4:00 to 6:30.
translation.ko: 이들과 함께 뛸 자신이 있는 분들은 내일 4시부터 6시 30분 사이에 오시면 됩니다

translation.en: They're looking for a few extra players to play.
[Chris] We were always looking for new talent, but no one stood out.
translation.ko: 늘 새 선수를 영입하고 싶었지만 눈에 띄는 사람이 없었어요

translation.en: There wasn't much streetball where I'm from in Keizer, Oregon.
translation.ko: 제 고향 오리건주 카이저에는 길거리농구랄 게 없었어요

translation.en: It was looked down upon.
Coaches, they didn't really respect that style of play.
translation.ko: 코치들은 그런 경기 스타일을 존중하지 않았어요

translation.en: [Grayson] Growing up, I wasn't really as into the NBA.
I liked watching AND1.
And then I got to high school. I was really small.
translation.ko: 그러다가 고등학교에 들어갔는데 키가 너무 작아서

translation.en: I kept getting cut from teams.
I had no college offers.
That was one of the biggest heartbreaks.
It wasn't a girlfriend or anything like that.
And I just decided to do something innovative
away from conventional basketball. Away from the NBA.
translation.ko: 뭔가 혁신적인 걸 해 봐야겠다고 생각했어요

translation.en: Slam Magazine released the routing of the tour.
I saw that Portland was on there.
So I put all that energy into training,
and I knew that this was my shot.
[Grayson] When I first got up there to open run tryouts,
I had never seen people all around the court.
translation.ko: 그렇게 많은 사람이 코트를 둘러싼 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: Kids and people standing on the fences to get a better view.
translation.ko: 어른, 아이 할 것 없이 잘 보려고 울타리 위에 올라섰죠

translation.en: Might be nerve-wracking with the tryout.
[man] We gotta pick three people.
We have to pick three people
to make it to play inside the arena!
When my shot came up, I wasn't even thinking about passing.
translation.ko: 제게 기회가 왔을 때 패스할 생각이 전혀 없었어요

translation.en: [announcer] Okay. Let me see them feet.
[Grayson] A lot of moves I pulled off, people were like losing their minds.
translation.ko: 제가 여러 동작을 선보였더니 사람들이 탄성을 질렀죠

translation.en: Right here, my man in the blue.
translation.ko: 여기, 파란 옷 입은 키 작은 친구요

translation.en: I'm just excited to play with Hot Sauce. All these dudes I've seen on tape.
translation.ko: 핫소스랑 뛸 생각에 신나요 이미 테이프로 봤거든요

translation.en: I see them in real life, it's almost like… it's just like a dream, you know?
Stepping inside the arena was so awesome.
translation.ko: 경기장에 들어가는 건 정말 멋진 경험이었어요

translation.en: And I'm like, "Man, we're here." Like… [chuckling] "We made it!"
So that first game playing against my idols was very surreal.
translation.ko: 제 우상들과 했던 첫 경기는 정말 비현실적이었어요

translation.en: Crowd went crazy over a few moves. They respected that I didn't back down.
translation.ko: 관중은 몇 가지 동작에 열광했어요 물러서지 않는 모습을 칭찬했고요

translation.en: [The Main Event] I made the overall pick.
Gotta go with you.
[Grayson] So they asked me to come on tour with them
as a contestant in this nationwide contest.
translation.ko: 참가자 자격으로 같이 투어를 돌자고 제안받았어요

translation.en: It kind of blew me away.
I'm thinking my parents wouldn't let me, but they were like, "Go ahead and do it."
translation.ko: 반대하실 줄 알았는데 부모님도 흔쾌히 허락하셨고요

translation.en: Going into the tour,
I knew that with every city, I definitely had a chance to go home.
translation.ko: 어느 도시에서든 탈락할 수 있다는 걸 알고 있었죠

translation.en: Because at every open run, a new player could knock somebody out.
translation.ko: 선발전마다 더 뛰어난 선수가 나타날 수 있으니까요

translation.en: So somebody was always coming, and somebody was always going.
translation.ko: 오는 사람이 있는 만큼 가야 할 사람도 있었어요

translation.en: [Headache] He's the first one, and the first one's always the hardest
translation.ko: 처음으로 발굴한 선수예요 원래 처음이 제일 힘들죠

translation.en: 'cause we got 29 more cities.
-Yeah. I'm at a disadvantage, huh? -Yeah.
For me, coming in there at 18, I actually felt like a kid amongst adults.
translation.ko: 18살에 처음 들어왔으니 어른 사이에 낀 아이 같았어요

translation.en: Sometimes you have, like, 14, 15 people on the bench,
and you just try to make the best with the time you got.
translation.ko: 주어진 시간 안에 기량을 최대한 선보여야 했죠

translation.en: [Duke] I said, "Yo, you know what? A white boy on this team?"
translation.ko: "네바다주 라스베이거스" 제가 그랬어요 '이 팀에 백인 꼬마가 있다고?'

translation.en: "That's gonna be my godson. I'mma adopt him."
I gave him his name as soon as I seen him.
translation.ko: 그 녀석을 만나자마자 이름을 지어 줬어요

translation.en: That's my boy, my godson,
the Rocky Balboa of basketball,
The Professor!
Anything a talented white boy could do in the hood
translation.ko: "프로페서 그레이슨 바우처" 동네에서 재능 있는 백인 소년이 뭘 좀 한다고 하면

translation.en: is amplified a million times.
But Professor is the real deal.
One of these three guys right here will be sent home tonight.
translation.ko: "유타주 솔트레이크시티 콜로라도주 덴버" 이 세 명 중 한 명은 오늘 밤 집으로 돌아갑니다

translation.en: Every elimination game, magic would happen.
translation.ko: 탈락자 선정 때마다 마법 같은 일이 벌어졌어요

translation.en: [Duke] Godson! The Professor! Putting it up! Oh yeah!
-Professor, I'll see you in Dallas. -Okay.
-All right? Be good. -All right.
It's a little bit of pressure, but that's what it's about.
translation.ko: 좀 부담이 되긴 하지만 그래도 어쩌겠어요

translation.en: 'Cause this contract will change somebody's life.
translation.ko: 계약을 하는 사람은 인생이 바뀌는 거잖아요

translation.en: What's up, man?
-[Gee Lock] Professor, you going home? -No. I ain't going nowhere.
translation.ko: - 프로페서, 오늘 집으로 돌아가? - 가긴 어딜 가

translation.en: I'm just… Go out there. Do my thing.
I'm just gonna keep doing what I've done every game that's got me to this point.
translation.ko: 날 여기까지 오게 한 실력을 계속 보여 줄 거야

translation.en: [Duke] Yeah. Look at the hold on Headache.
translation.ko: "루이지애나주 뉴올리언스" 그렇죠, 헤데이크가 꼼짝 못 하는 거 보세요

translation.en: Oh yeah! Oh yeah! Yeah! Yeah!
Yeah, baby!
[The Professor] The last stop was Linden, New Jersey.
This court right here is basically the genesis. This is where it started.
translation.ko: 이 농구 코트가 바로 시초야 이곳에서 모든 것이 시작됐지

translation.en: Go ahead and play to 21.
Then after that, the team's gonna get together.
We're gonna make a decision.
[The Professor] It was AND1 players and the contestants going against each other.
You can do it on the commercial circuit, but can you do it in the hood?
translation.ko: 정식 경기장에서 잘했듯이 길거리에서도 잘하는지 보는 거죠

translation.en: Can you do it playing against us?
Even to start that game, like, Sik Wit It got me crazy on some fake pass.
translation.ko: 경기 시작부터 식 위트 잇이 페이크 패스로 제 혼을 빼놨어요

translation.en: I mean, I was like, "Dang." Like, I know I'm definitely behind now.
translation.ko: 뒤처지고 있는 걸 느끼며 탄식을 내뱉었죠

translation.en: And then a couple plays later, I'd block a shot.
translation.ko: 플레이를 몇 번 더 한 뒤 제가 슛 하나를 막았고

translation.en: Hit some shots.
Played really well, but so did the other guys.
translation.ko: 경기력이 아주 좋았지만 다른 선수들도 마찬가지였어요

translation.en: [Duke] Professor. Hot Sauce. Hot Sauce. Professor.
-[Duke] That's the game! -[man] That's it!
When they go to the final vote, I didn't think I would get the votes.
translation.ko: 최종 투표를 진행했어요 표를 못 받을 줄 알았죠

translation.en: [Half Man Half Amazing] I wanna tell y'all congratulations
that the man to get this contract is gonna be…
El Professor.
-Okay? -Thanks, man.
[Half Man Half Amazing] Gonna be that man.
I couldn't believe it. It was a dream come true.
translation.ko: 믿을 수가 없었어요 꿈이 이뤄지는 순간이었죠

translation.en: I had put in all this hard work, and now I'm an AND1 streetballer.
translation.ko: 열심히 노력한 결과 앤드원 선수가 된 거예요 "교외의 전설"

translation.en: Checking out the first episode. Looks pretty good.
[Seth] When the TV show on ESPN came out,
I wasn't, quite frankly, even sure if people would watch.
translation.ko: 솔직히 말하면 보는 사람이 있긴 할까 싶었어요

translation.en: [reporter] Yo, the line is not down the block. It is the block.
translation.ko: 블록을 따라 줄이 생긴 게 아니라 줄 자체가 한 블록을 형성했어요

translation.en: Like, open up the door, bam!
Shane, Shane, Shane! Man, man, man!
Wow. This is something. People were going crazy.
translation.ko: 와, 장난 아니던데요 사람들이 미쳐 날뛰었어요

translation.en: We out here, mad love. Mad love out here.
translation.ko: 여기 우리 팬들 좀 봐요 열기가 장난 아니죠

translation.en: -Give me your headband! Give me something! -Give me your do-rag!
The AND1 Mixtape Tour is coming to town this weekend.
translation.ko: '앤드원 믹스 테이프 투어'가 이번 주말에 찾아옵니다

translation.en: -[anchor] Who's that guy, The Professor? -[anchor 2] Isn't he something?
translation.ko: - 그 프로페서란 사람이 누구죠? - 정말 대단하지 않아요?

translation.en: The fanfare was surreal because it happened for me overnight.
translation.ko: 축하 세례가 꿈만 같았어요 하룻밤 사이에 벌어진 일이니까요

translation.en: Thank you, sweetie! [laughing]
America loves this kid. The ratings is going out of this world.
translation.ko: 미국은 이 친구에게 푹 빠졌어요 시청률은 하늘을 찔렀고요

translation.en: [Gee Lock] After being with the AND1 tour,
he had cornrows like a black dude. He had the diamond studs in.
translation.ko: 흑인처럼 콘로 머리를 했어요 다이아몬드 귀걸이도 달았고요

translation.en: Before the game, he was talking like Opie. After the game, he was Eminem.
translation.ko: 경기 전에는 오피처럼 말하고 경기 후에는 에미넘이 됐어요

translation.en: It turned into the Jackson Five. That's Michael Jackson.
translation.ko: 잭슨 파이브가 됐죠 프로페서는 마이클 잭슨이고요

translation.en: I love you, Professor!
He's only 11.
I remember his first groupie.
translation.ko: 프로페서의 첫 번째 소녀 팬이 기억나요

translation.en: I knew that would change his life.
translation.ko: 그거로 그 친구 인생이 바뀔 줄 저는 알았어요

translation.en: Hold on.
I was a really shy kid in high school, but I definitely embraced it, you know?
translation.ko: 고등학교 때 수줍음이 많았는데 전 그걸 받아들였어요

translation.en: The ESPN show, it just put us out there on a whole nother level.
translation.ko: ESPN 쇼가 우리를 한 차원 끌어올려 줬죠

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] NBA players and celebrities, they was loving it.
In case you didn't see that move, rewind it back.
translation.ko: 그 동작을 못 보셨다면 테이프를 되감으세요

translation.en: AND1 Mixtape Tour! I love this game!
translation.ko: '앤드원 믹스 테이프 투어' 마음에 쏙 들어요

translation.en: At that point, we started to charge money for people to come to a game,
translation.ko: 그 시점에서 우리는 입장료를 받기 시작했고

translation.en: and we were selling out NBA venues.
[Skip 2 My Lou] A couple of arenas we went to,
we had more fans in that arena than they had for their own home team.
translation.ko: 홈 팀 팬보다 우리 팬이 더 많을 정도였죠

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] I'll never forget.
We're in the club, and I see the Detroit Pistons
just won their second NBA championship,
translation.ko: 이제 막 NBA에서 두 번째 우승을 했을 때였어요

translation.en: and I'm telling the DJ, "Yo, Chauncey Billups is here."
translation.ko: 제가 DJ에게 말했죠 '봐요, 촌시 빌럽스가 왔어요!'

translation.en: [commentator] Chauncey Billups, a likely candidate for the MVP Award.
And then the DJ looked at me and says, "Man, fuck them. Y'all here."
translation.ko: DJ가 저를 보며 이렇게 말했어요 '그게 왜요? 당신들이 왔는걸요'

translation.en: [Duke] You know about it. You heard about it.
translation.ko: 다들 잘 아실 거예요 얘기도 들어 보셨을 거고요

translation.en: Now we're taking it to the next level. Now it's time to take it across the water.
translation.ko: 이제 다음 단계로 넘어가야죠 바다를 건널 거예요

translation.en: This is a global invasion.
Our first international tour, I mean, it was shocking.
It was actually bigger than the United States. Like, actually way bigger.
translation.ko: 미국보다 더 열광했죠 훨씬 더 많이요

translation.en: -Make some noise, Tokyo! -[crowd roars]
[Skip 2 My Lou] This is the AND1 Mixtape Tour.
Right now, Australian zoo. Me and my homie the koala right now.
translation.ko: 지금은 호주 동물원에서 제 친구 코알라와 함께 있어요

translation.en: Now, everything was first class. We're staying in the Ritz-Carlton.
translation.ko: 모든 게 최고 수준이었어요 리츠칼튼 호텔에서 묵었고요

translation.en: These guys was rock star shit.
[Gee Lock] So, dudes used to go to the autographs
'cause chicks was gonna fucking swarm.
[speaking indistinctly] Go to Hot Sauce.
I love him.
[woman] AND1, baby.
[The Dribbling Machine] We had guys come up with their wives.
There's nothing to sign, and she pulls her titty out,
translation.ko: 사인할 곳이 없는데 갑자기 가슴을 꺼내는 거죠

translation.en: and it's like, "You want me to sign your wife's titty?"
AND1 tour? We're partying, drinking, smoking.
translation.ko: 앤드원 투어요? 파티하고 술 마시고 담배 피웠죠

translation.en: [Gee Lock] They had a camera. They be like, "Yo. We got the night cam."
And I'm like, "What y'all looking at?"
translation.ko: 저는 다들 뭘 그렇게 보나 했는데

translation.en: It was all of them having a massive orgy with some bad chick!
translation.ko: 웬 까진 여자랑 요란한 난교 파티를 하는 거예요

translation.en: I was like, "Yo! I seen her at the game!"
translation.ko: 제가 그랬죠 '야, 나 저 여자 경기장에서 봤어'

translation.en: "Damn!" [laughing]
[chuckling] He lying. No, just-- [laughing]
He just joking again.
The AND1 groove, it was so fast that nobody could stop us.
translation.ko: 앤드원은 성장했어요 너무 빨리 성장한 나머지 아무도 막을 수 없었죠

translation.en: The AND1 Mixtape Tour, presented by Mountain Dew.
translation.ko: 마운틴 듀 협찬 '앤드원 믹스 테이프 투어'입니다

translation.en: [Jay] Now we've got sponsors coming in.
Took it from the streets, to the arenas, to video games.
[Seth] My team showed me a stat one day
translation.ko: "리듬 타기 750점" 어느 날 팀이 통계를 보여 주면서

translation.en: that Streetball was the number one male-rated TV show on ESPN.
translation.ko: 남성 시청자들이 '스트리트볼'을 ESPN 최고 쇼로 뽑았다고 하더군요

translation.en: I'm like, "Fuck you, man. Like, stop."
translation.ko: 저는 말도 안 된다며 농담하지 말라고 했죠

translation.en: And they said, "Streetball is the number one TV show
for male teens on ESPN."
I was like, "Holy F."
[man] What's up?
With the Mixtape Tour becoming a huge breakout success…
We went from 15 to 70 people within a two or three-year period.
We made a decision for a long-term space.
So, the office had to have a basketball court.
translation.ko: 회사에는 반드시 농구 코트가 있어야 했죠

translation.en: [Jay] Now we're a big national brand, how do we expand our footprint?
translation.ko: 이제 전국적인 브랜드가 됐는데 어떻게 발자취를 뻗어 나갈까요?

translation.en: So we decided we're gonna take one more shot on shoes.
translation.ko: 그래서 한 번 더 시도해 보기로 했어요 신발을요

translation.en: [Jay] The first Marbury shoe was ugly, heavy, overpriced.
translation.ko: 첫 번째 마버리 신발은 흉했고 무거운 데다가 비싸기까지 했으니

translation.en: And that problem lied with me,
as the person who was overseeing that product.
I was always giving Jay notes, like,
"Hey, Jay, you should do this. Jay, you should do that."
translation.ko: 이걸 해 봐라 저걸 해 봐라 하면서요

translation.en: And Jay's like, "Tom, I am sick of you telling me the stuff you could do."
"Do you wanna give it a shot?"
I was maybe 25, and I was like, "Yeah." Like, I didn't have a doubt.
translation.ko: 그때 25살쯤이었는데 한 치의 의구심도 없이 수락했죠

translation.en: I had a really clear idea of what a basketball shoe should be.
translation.ko: 농구화가 어때야 한다는 명확한 그림이 있었어요

translation.en: Shoes should be light. They should be fast.
They should be airy, like running shoes.
And we should use meshes and composites.
My first idea was slip-on shoes, called the Post-Game.
[man] I mean, it's a whole other level now.
They're bringing it, and then we're loving it.
I mean, keep doing what you're doing.
When I was a kid, people would wear two different shoes just for fashion.
translation.ko: 제가 어렸을 때 다들 패션용으로 두 가지 신발을 신었는데

translation.en: That was the inspiration for the Tai Chi.
Visual-wise, you see the different colors. Like you're wearing different shoes.
translation.ko: 두 가지 색깔을 써서 시각적으로 다른 신발을 신은 것 같아요

translation.en: -Hey! What's up? -What's up?
I remember the feeling of shock when those Tai Chis flew off the shelves.
translation.ko: 타이치가 불티나게 팔렸을 때의 충격을 아직도 잊지 못해요

translation.en: [man] This is a really dope look.
Whoo! Fire on these.
One of the best basketball shoes, period.
translation.ko: 누가 뭐래도 최고의 농구화 중 하나예요

translation.en: [Seth] It became AND1's all-time best-selling shoe.
translation.ko: 앤드원 역사상 가장 많이 팔린 신발이 됐어요

translation.en: That product went from 0 to 65 million in 18 months.
translation.ko: 출시 후 18개월 만에 매출 6,500만 달러를 기록했죠

translation.en: [The Main Event] It started with the trash-talking shirts.
translation.ko: "스타일과 퍼포먼스" 도발하는 셔츠로 시작해 지금은 차원이 달라졌어요

translation.en: Now it's on a whole other level.
translation.ko: 도발하는 셔츠로 시작해 지금은 차원이 달라졌어요

translation.en: Every shoe company, we're coming.
You see the neighborhood hustlers and drug dealers.
They're wearing the AND1.
[Tom] We had styles that would either outsell Nike or be number two to them.
translation.ko: 나이키 판매량을 능가하거나 2위를 기록한 신발들도 있었죠

translation.en: [Tom] You know, if you're going up against Nike,
they have 50 times more people in every department.
translation.ko: 그쪽 각 부서의 직원 수는 우리의 50배나 됐어요

translation.en: And when they go and make a marquee shoe for Michael Jordan,
translation.ko: 마이클 조던의 신발처럼 중요한 제품을 만들 때는

translation.en: they may take several years.
And we have, like, five dudes on design. [chuckling]
translation.ko: 그런데 우리는 디자인 팀이 고작 다섯 명이었어요

translation.en: Sometimes Tom would be in his office for, like, three days.
translation.ko: 톰은 사흘씩 사무실에 있을 때도 있었어요

translation.en: [Tom] I logged long hours, but I really loved it.
translation.ko: 회사에서 오랜 시간을 보냈죠 하지만 정말 좋았어요

translation.en: That energy was infectious to the rest of us.
[anchor] Jordan's have sprung
from the creative partnership of shoe designer Tinker Hatfield.
translation.ko: 신발 디자이너 팅커 햇필드와의 파트너십으로 만들어진 제품입니다

translation.en: [Jay] In a time where designers become their own celebrities,
Tom was super low-key, never wanted to have his name out there.
translation.ko: 톰은 절대 이름을 내보내지 않았고 노출을 극도로 피했어요

translation.en: But he was one of the most incredibly creative designers.
translation.ko: 하지만 톰은 가장 창의적인 디자이너 중 한 명이었죠

translation.en: I'm running my little kingdom. Just gonna generate high-quality shoes,
translation.ko: 내 왕국을 운영하면서 질 좋은 신발을 만들어 내고

translation.en: and if I keep doing my job, we're gonna beat Nike.
translation.ko: 내 일만 잘한다면 나이키도 누를 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: [Duke] Playing at Madison Square Garden, the mecca.
translation.ko: 성지인 매디슨 스퀘어 가든에서 경기를 했어요

translation.en: You know that I was hyped.
[The Main Event] The anticipation was crazy.
[The Main Event] I'm looking around like,
"Damn, this is what it would have been like in the NBA?"
We're in their same locker room. It's the same atmosphere.
translation.ko: 같은 라커 룸에서 같은 분위기를 느낀 거예요

translation.en: [announcer] Welcome to New York City!
Took me 25 years to get here. I'm ready to cry.
translation.ko: 여기까지 오는 데 25년 걸렸어요 난 이길 준비가 됐어요

translation.en: I'm feeling this. I'm really feeling this.
[The Main Event] Out of all the games we wanted to win, we wanted to win at Madison Square Garden
translation.ko: 매디슨 스퀘어 가든에서 이기는 게 그 무엇보다 간절했어요

translation.en: because at the end of the day, you definitely want to win where you from.
[Hot Sauce] I'm actually on the NBA floor, scared as hell.
translation.ko: NBA 코트에 섰는데 얼마나 겁이 났는지 몰라요

translation.en: But you would never know it, walking around shaking your head,
translation.ko: 하지만 알 길이 없었겠죠 머리를 흔들면서

translation.en: like, "Yeah, Sauce, you about to kill,"
translation.ko: 인생 경기를 보여 줄 것처럼 자신 있게 걸었으니까요

translation.en: and deep down inside, I'm scared as a motherfucker, boy.
I'm scared as hell.
[Gee Lock] You had dreams of going to the NBA, you already felt like you made it
translation.ko: NBA 진출이라는 꿈을 이미 이룬 것만 같았어요

translation.en: because here's your name on the big scoreboard.
Here's your name in bright lights.
translation.ko: 환한 불빛 속에 내 이름이 나오는 거예요

translation.en: I'm playing in front of thousands of people.
Boy, when we played on to that old-school Madison Square Garden court?
That bring a tear to your eye. That emotional.
translation.ko: 눈에 눈물이 고일 만큼 감동적인 순간이었어요

translation.en: That was our bragging rights to our family, to our friends on,
translation.ko: 그 경기 덕분에 가족과 친구들에게 자랑할 수 있었어요

translation.en: "No. We didn't make the NBA, but we made it."
translation.ko: '우린 NBA에는 못 갔지만 그래도 목표를 이뤘어'

translation.en: [announcer] Are you ready?
[Duke] Professor! Alley-oop!
-Oh yeah! Yeah! -[crowd shouting, cheering]
It was ridiculous. I couldn't believe it.
translation.ko: 진짜 굉장했어요 꼭 꿈을 꾸는 것 같았죠

translation.en: It took so much time and energy to get here.
translation.ko: 여기까지 오는 데 정말 많은 시간과 노력을 쏟았어요

translation.en: [Duke] Oh baby! It's Sizzle and The Pharmacist.
The New York game was a competitive game.
It was unlike all of most of our other games.
[Duke] Jump shot, 15-footer, nothing but the bottom of the net on.
Helicopter. Looking at it. Bounce pass. Watch this!
In Madison Square Garden, if there's enough excitement,
translation.ko: 매디슨 스퀘어 가든에서 관객이 극도로 흥분하면

translation.en: the building shakes. Half the block shakes.
translation.ko: 건물이 흔들리고 그 블록 절반이 흔들려요

translation.en: [Duke] Looking to change. Professor. AO!
No matter who's on the floor, we gotta keep this intensity.
translation.ko: 누가 나가서 뛰든 계속 선두를 지켜야 해

translation.en: [Duke] That jump shot is good!
Oh gravy!
This is The Main Event! Man.
You done hit a jump shot in front of 19,000 people at the mecca.
translation.ko: 1만 9천 명이 지켜보는 성지에서 점프 샷에 성공한다면

translation.en: You can't get no better than that.
[The Main Event] I met AND1 when I was 26 years old.
That bulk of my NBA days was over,
translation.ko: 내 인생의 NBA 시절은 그렇게 끝났지만

translation.en: but my story, in a nutshell, is that I never gave up.
translation.ko: 제 이야기의 요점은 절대 포기하지 않았다는 거예요

translation.en: [Duke] New York City!
If you like what you see, then make some noise!
[Duke] Let's give it up for both these ball clubs!
translation.ko: 두 구단을 위해 박수 보내 주세요

translation.en: You got it. You can get it.
-[man] Tell me about playing it, though. -Hey, man…
That shit was fun, man.
Let's get in, man.
-One, two, three, AND1. -[all] AND1!
[commentator] So we're ready for the first slam dunk competition in three years.
translation.ko: 3년 만에 열리는 첫 슬램 덩크 대회입니다

translation.en: The last time…
Never forget watching the dunk contest with Vince Carter,
translation.ko: 빈스 카터가 출전했던 덩크 슛 대회는 절대 못 잊어요

translation.en: who later signed with Nike.
[commentator 1] …and here is the man that this crowd wants to see.
translation.ko: 관중이 보고 싶어 하는 한 선수가 있습니다

translation.en: Vince Carter with his first dunk!
[commentator 2] Let's go home!
And Vince has maybe the best performance ever
in a dunk contest in AND1 Tai Chis.
translation.ko: 덩크 슛 대회에서 최고의 덩크를 보여 줬어요

translation.en: Watching it blew our minds.
translation.ko: 그 모습을 보고 다들 몹시 흥분했어요

translation.en: We pretty much lose our cool, right? It's like, "This is awesome."
And he did things that nobody thought were even possible.
translation.ko: 모두가 불가능하다고 생각한 일을 해낸 거예요

translation.en: While wearing our product.
We were like, "Thank you so much for wearing our shoes for free."
translation.ko: 우리 신발을 공짜로 신어 줘서 얼마나 고마웠는지 몰라요

translation.en: [Tom] That was the peak of AND1, you know?
And I think it was literally like two or three months later.
I turned on the TV.
I heard a ball bouncing. Boom. Ba-boom. Ba-boom, boom, boom.
-[man grunting] -[Seth] And I see the logo.
The first word that entered my brain was "fuck."
It's Nike.
Freestyle is all about hip-hop, streetball, and self-expression.
translation.ko: "나이키 '프리스타일'" 프리스타일은 "지미 스미스 위든 + 케네디 카피라이터" 힙합, 길거리농구 자기표현에 관한 거예요

translation.en: They've co-opted our streetball positioning
with this incredibly beautifully shot TV campaign.
translation.ko: 아름답게 찍어낸 TV 광고 속으로 끌어들인 거죠

translation.en: I mean, that was a good spot.
It's got an attitude. Hip-hop beat to it.
But it's Nike, and they're better than that. They're copying us.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리보다 나은 나이키가 우릴 베낀 거예요

translation.en: [Jay] That TV commercial achieved more in 30 seconds
translation.ko: "바운스, 바운스 튀는 공을 따라서" 나이키는 그 30초짜리 TV 광고를 통해

translation.en: than we did over five years of the Mixtape.
translation.ko: 우리가 5년 동안 '믹스 테이프'로 이뤄낸 것 이상을 해냈어요

translation.en: Gotta be the shoes. Nike surging.
translation.ko: 신발 덕분일 겁니다 나이키가 급등세를 탔습니다

translation.en: [reporter 1] Investors came running back to Nike.
It's living up to its motto. "Just Do It."
[reporter 2] Just taking over this whole streetball game.
They took our movement,
put a nice shiny satin bow on it with some glitter, and called it theirs.
translation.ko: 반짝반짝 광을 낸 뒤 자기 것이라고 한 거예요

translation.en: They basically crushed us in the snap of a finger.
translation.ko: 손가락 한번 튕겨서 우릴 깔아뭉갠 거죠 "흥분의 거리를 찾다"

translation.en: [narrator] In a fight for glory, heart is mandatory.
translation.ko: 영광을 위한 싸움에서 어려움은 피할 수 없는 길

translation.en: Nike Underground's King of the Court. Sundays at 8:00 pm, 7:00 central on MTV2.
translation.ko: '나이키 배틀그라운즈: 코트의 왕' 일요일 오후 8시 MTV2에서 방영됩니다

translation.en: I don't know if they spent 10 million, 20 million, 50 million behind it.
I know when I saw that TV commercial that I realized,
translation.ko: 그 TV 광고를 본 순간 망했다는 걸 깨달았죠

translation.en: "Shit. We don't have time to wait. Let's go."
"We gotta make some decisions. We gotta move."
I'm on TV!
[producer] How would you respond to someone who felt that the company
translation.ko: 회사가 선수들을 이용해서 부를 축적했다고 느끼는 사람이 있다면

translation.en: built its wealth off the back of the players?
How would I respond
to somebody feeling like the players was exploited by the company?
I would say, "I know the company was making a lot of money."
translation.ko: 회사가 돈을 많이 벌었다는 건 안다고 답하겠죠

translation.en: After the games, you see the merchandise booth.
translation.ko: 경기가 끝나고 나면 상품 판매 부스가 보이거든요

translation.en: Mad units with they faces on it, right?
[man] We sold out again.
[Gee Lock] Players be like, "Yo. I ain't get paid for that."
translation.ko: 선수들은 왜 자기들한테 떨어지는 게 없느냐고 했죠

translation.en: It was the downfall of everything.
translation.ko: 그게 모든 것이 무너지는 계기가 됐죠

translation.en: [woman] We're at the warehouse.
translation.ko: 저희는 창고에서 일하며 앤드원 제품을 받아

translation.en: We receive, ship, and pack, uh, the AND1 product for everyone.
translation.ko: 저희는 창고에서 일하며 앤드원 제품을 받아 포장하고 배송하는 일을 해요

translation.en: [The Dribbling Machine] Up at 8:00 just to meet the people in the warehouse.
translation.ko: 창고에서 일하는 사람들 만나려고 아침 8시에 일어났어요

translation.en: Courtesy.
How many courtesy things are we gonna do?
translation.ko: 무료로 하는 일을 얼마나 더 해야 해요?

translation.en: This company was making millions and millions of dollars.
But we the ones who make the money for y'all.
translation.ko: 그게 다 우리 덕에 번 거잖아요

translation.en: It started becoming a thing that we're gettin' pizza,
translation.ko: 언제부턴가 그렇게 됐어요 우리는 피자를 받는데

translation.en: but we go on a staff bus,
they got everything.
They got filet mignon, calamari, seltzer water,
all the good shit.
What are you eating, Shane?
Before the game, uh,
Buca shrimp parmesan.
[Chris] A lot of guys would say, "You got to take care of us."
"Why are we not eating?"
translation.ko: '왜 먹을 걸 제대로 안 챙겨 줘요?'

translation.en: "Wouldn't be no tour if there were no players."
Because you're not wrong. Like, y'all should be eating,
translation.ko: 틀린 말은 아니죠 다들 먹어야 하니까요

translation.en: but you don't gotta be so aggressive with it.
translation.ko: 하지만 꼭 그렇게 공격적이어야 했냐는 거예요

translation.en: [Headache] I'm throwing it… I'm throwing it on their bus.
[Duke] It's over now.
He throws a hot pizza on the tour manager's face!
translation.ko: 투어 매니저 얼굴에 뜨거운 피자를 던졌지 뭐예요!

translation.en: [Headache] Tell her what I said. Tell her she got one more time.
translation.ko: 내 말대로 전해 기회를 딱 한 번 더 주겠다고

translation.en: I'll smack the shit out of her. I'm dead serious.
translation.ko: 개 패듯이 패 버릴 거야 농담 아니야

translation.en: [producer] How did you guys decide which players would be making
a certain amount of money over others?
Not me. The only… The only conversation I ever got involved with
translation.ko: 제가 정한 게 아니에요 제가 대화해 본 사람이라곤

translation.en: was with Sauce and his agent.
It's my hometown. Still go down.
[Seth] He says, "Hey, Seth. You're a really nice guy."
translation.ko: 제게 그러더군요 '세스, 당신 참 좋은 사람이에요'

translation.en: I think to myself, "Yes, I am, motherfucker."
He says, "Hey. Sauce wants this, or he's gonna go to Reebok."
translation.ko: 핫소스가 요구 사항을 안 들어주면 리복으로 가겠다고 했다길래

translation.en: I was like, "Let him go to Reebok, bro."
Reebok's gonna kill that dude's career. Nobody wants to be with Reebok.
translation.ko: 리복이 경력을 망칠 거라고요 누가 리복이랑 계약하려고 해요?

translation.en: It was interesting 'cause there really wasn't a pay structure.
Main Event was like 90 to 100.
And AO was around that, 80 to 90.
Half Man was between like 60 and 75.
We had lower-tier guys that were getting like 15.
But that's for three months of work.
Because by the time September rolled around, there is no more tours.
But we would judge guys on who got the most "oohs" and "ahs,"
translation.ko: 우리는 환호성 받는 정도를 기준으로 평가했는데

translation.en: and obviously, Hot Sauce was the man.
It was plenty of moments of dudes feeling frustrated,
of not making enough money as somebody else was making.
But on the AND1 tours, best to not tell nobody how much you getting,
translation.ko: 앤드원 투어에선 얼마를 받는지 함구하는 게 낫지만

translation.en: but they gonna say it because they like stunting on each other.
translation.ko: 당연히 그걸 밝혔죠 관심 끌길 좋아했으니까요

translation.en: Let's go, baby.
Dollars, dollars, dollars. Yeah.
I had to get something new for 2005, you know.
A little bling. A little something.
This is Sizzle's crib. You know what I'm saying?
This… this is my second crib. I got two cribs, whatever.
translation.ko: 저의 두 번째 집이에요 집이 두 채거든요

translation.en: I remember Hot Sauce had a car that could talk.
[car] Greetings, Hot Sauce.
[laughing] People hated that shit.
I tried to never get into any money talks.
translation.ko: 저는 돈 얘기를 안 하려고 했어요

translation.en: I knew that I was sort of the new guy, and I had a lot of marketability,
translation.ko: 전 늦게 합류한 편이고 시장성이 좋은 데다가

translation.en: and I felt like my salary was great.
[director] And action.
There was definitely a little jealousy rolling around
translation.ko: 다른 선수보다 더 많이 홍보되는 선수를 향한

translation.en: from players being promoted more than others.
[AO] You see cats.
They had one or two big games. They are "streetball legends."
translation.ko: 큰 경기를 한두 번 치렀다고 '길거리농구의 전설'이라고 해요

translation.en: We was grinding like… nine, ten years
before we even knew what AND1 was.
[Headache] Oh man, don't get me wrong. Professor's a heck of a basketball player,
but, um, I question sometimes his motive.
[The Professor] It doesn't really bother me. I mean,
translation.ko: 전 별로 신경 안 써요, 뭐…

translation.en: as long as we're out on tour having fun, I really don't care what they think.
translation.ko: 투어를 다니면서 즐겁기만 하면 누가 뭐라고 하든 상관없어요

translation.en: Honestly.
The rock star started getting into everybody's head.
translation.ko: 다들 자기가 록스타가 됐다고 생각하기 시작했어요

translation.en: And everybody started thinking about the money.
You… You stop acting like that, man. Damn, man, fuck!
translation.ko: 그런 식으로 행동하지 마 씨발, 진짜

translation.en: [man] How you figure that?
Where you getting the check from?
If I wasn't here, I'd be out playing and making money.
translation.ko: 여기가 아니었다면 경기 뛰면서 돈 벌고 있었겠지

translation.en: This tour? It's breaking me. I'm not making money.
translation.ko: 이 투어 다녀 봤자 제대로 버는 돈도 없잖아

translation.en: My contract ain't shit, man. I'm telling y'all niggas. It ain't shit, yo! It ain't shit!
translation.ko: 내 계약은 진짜 쓰레기야 진짜로, 쓰레기라니까

translation.en: I'm eating off this. I'm making plenty of money.
I don't know about you, man. My living expenses ain't like yours.
translation.ko: 네가 어떤진 모르겠다 나랑 스케일이 다른가 보지

translation.en: You live in luxury, nigga. You live in luxury. I'm still living in the projects, nigga!
translation.ko: 호화롭게 사나 본데 난 아직 주택 단지에서 살아

translation.en: We got too many all-stars.
When you create a monster,
you gotta know how to tame a monster.
The animosity against each other boiled up to a point
translation.ko: 서로에 대한 적대감이 점점 쌓여 갔고

translation.en: where it was becoming bigger and bigger and bigger.
